required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: STudy to vAlidate telemetRic ECG Systems for firsT Dose Administration of Fingolimod (START)
clinical_study.official_title: A 1-week, Open-label, Multi-center Study to Explore Conduction Abnormalities During First Dose Administration of Fingolimod in Patients With Relapsing-remitting Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluated bradycardiac events during first dose observation of fingolimod in MS patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With 2nd or 3rd Degree Atrioventricular (AV) Block
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, during 6 hour monitoring post first dose observation
primary_outcome.description: AV Blocks/Heart block is an abnormal heart rhythm where the heart beats too slowly; the electrical signals that tell the heart to contract are partially intermittent (Type 2:1) or slowed (1st and 2nd degree) or blocked (3rd degree) between the upper chambers (atria) and the lower chambers (ventricles). In 2nd degree AV Blocks, electrical impulses are intermittent (type 2:1) or delayed w/ each subsequent heartbeat (Mobitz type I) until a beat fails to reach the ventricles entirely. This type of block often is physiologic and observed in a highly relaxed state & during sleep. In 2nd degree AV Blocks type II, the atria electrical impulses are unable to reach the ventricles, a more serious condition. In 3rd degree AV Blocks (complete heart block), none of the electrical impulses reach either the atria or the ventricles. Patients can experience simultaneously both types of 2nd or 3rd degree AV Blocks without any symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Heart Rate Below 45 Beats Per Minute (BPM)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline during 6 hour monitoring post dose
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with heart rate below 45 beats bpm in ECG during first dose observation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Prolonged QTc Interval (Friderica)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with conduction abnormalities such as QT prolongation, first degree AV block during treatment initiation. The QT interval is a period between the activation and the regeneration of ventricular contraction. A prolonged QT interval can be a potential marker of cardiac arrhythmias. Two patients of the safety analysis set discontinued the study without having received treatment, but safety information was collected on these two patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Bradyarrhythmic Electrocardiogram (ECG) Events
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with bradyarrhythmic electrocardiogram (ECG) events was assessed. Bradyarrhythmic ECG events are defined as QTc Fridericia time > 450 ms for males and > 470 ms for females.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Cardiac Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The number of participants with the occurrence of subsequent cardiac adverse events (AEs) and serious cardiac AEs during study was assessed. Cardiac events were defined as the following Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) preferred terms: angina pectoris, chest discomfort, dizziness, dyspnoea, dyspnoea exertional, fatigue, palpitations, syncope, vertigo, vertigo positional and vision blurred.

arm_group.description: Fingolimod 0.5 mg by mouth once daily for 7 days.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with relapsing remitting MS.
- Patients with highly active disease despite a full and adequate course of treatment with at least one disease modifying therapy.
- Patients who had been previously on 2nd line therapies. It was understood that these patients satisfied the above mentioned criteria listed under a. in the past.
This also included patients, who were previously treated with fingolimod (regardless of whether or not they had already been treated within the START study) but discontinued treatment due to medical reasons.
- or patients with rapidly evolving severe RRMS (e.g. > 2 relapses with disease progression in one year and > 1 Gd-enhancing lesion or with a significant increase in T2 lesions compared to a recent MRI).
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- immunocompromised patients
- active infections
- pregnant or nursing women, women of childbearing potential unless using 2 reliable forms of contraception
- presence of malignancy (other than localized basal cell carcinoma of the skin).

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 6998 participants were enrolled into the study and were considered as part of the safety set, but 2 participants discontinued from the study and did not take any study drug.

group.title: Fingolimod
group.description: Fingolimod 0.5 mg by mouth once daily for 7 days.

outcome.title: Participants With 2nd or 3rd Degree Atrioventricular (AV) Block
outcome.description: AV Blocks/Heart block is an abnormal heart rhythm where the heart beats too slowly; the electrical signals that tell the heart to contract are partially intermittent (Type 2:1) or slowed (1st and 2nd degree) or blocked (3rd degree) between the upper chambers (atria) and the lower chambers (ventricles). In 2nd degree AV Blocks, electrical impulses are intermittent (type 2:1) or delayed w/ each subsequent heartbeat (Mobitz type I) until a beat fails to reach the ventricles entirely. This type of block often is physiologic and observed in a highly relaxed state & during sleep. In 2nd degree AV Blocks type II, the atria electrical impulses are unable to reach the ventricles, a more serious condition. In 3rd degree AV Blocks (complete heart block), none of the electrical impulses reach either the atria or the ventricles. Patients can experience simultaneously both types of 2nd or 3rd degree AV Blocks without any symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: baseline, during 6 hour monitoring post first dose observation
outcome.population: Safety set: The safety set consisted of all enrolled participants for whom safety information was collected. Two patients of the safety analysis set discontinued the study without having received treatment, but safety information was collected on these two patients.

group.title: Fingolimod

measure.description: AV Blocks/Heart block is an abnormal heart rhythm where the heart beats too slowly; the electrical signals that tell the heart to contract are partially intermittent (Type 2:1) or slowed (1st and 2nd degree) or blocked (3rd degree) between the upper chambers (atria) and the lower chambers (ventricles). In 2nd degree AV Blocks, electrical impulses are intermittent (type 2:1) or delayed w/ each subsequent heartbeat (Mobitz type I) until a beat fails to reach the ventricles entirely. This type of block often is physiologic and observed in a highly relaxed state & during sleep. In 2nd degree AV Blocks type II, the atria electrical impulses are unable to reach the ventricles, a more serious condition. In 3rd degree AV Blocks (complete heart block), none of the electrical impulses reach either the atria or the ventricles. Patients can experience simultaneously both types of 2nd or 3rd degree AV Blocks without any symptoms.
measure.population: Safety set: The safety set consisted of all enrolled participants for whom safety information was collected. Two patients of the safety analysis set discontinued the study without having received treatment, but safety information was collected on these two patients.

class.title: Any AV block ll degree or higher
AV block ll degree: Mobitz type I degree
AV block II degree: Mobitz type II degree

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Heart Rate Below 45 Beats Per Minute (BPM)
outcome.description: Number of patients with heart rate below 45 beats bpm in ECG during first dose observation
outcome.time_frame: baseline during 6 hour monitoring post dose
outcome.population: Safety set: The safety set consisted of all enrolled participants for whom safety information was collected. Two patients of the safety analysis set discontinued the study without having received treatment, but safety information was collected on these two patients.

group.title: Fingolimod
group.description: Fingolimod 0.5 mg by mouth once daily for 7 days.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Heart Rate Below 45 Beats Per Minute (BPM)
measure.description: Number of patients with heart rate below 45 beats bpm in ECG during first dose observation
measure.population: Safety set: The safety set consisted of all enrolled participants for whom safety information was collected. Two patients of the safety analysis set discontinued the study without having received treatment, but safety information was collected on these two patients.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Prolonged QTc Interval (Friderica)
outcome.description: Number of patients with conduction abnormalities such as QT prolongation, first degree AV block during treatment initiation. The QT interval is a period between the activation and the regeneration of ventricular contraction. A prolonged QT interval can be a potential marker of cardiac arrhythmias. Two patients of the safety analysis set discontinued the study without having received treatment, but safety information was collected on these two patients.
outcome.population: The safety set, which consisted of all enrolled participants for whom safety information was collected, was considered for the analysis. Only participants, who had baseline post-dose QTc interval data, were analyzed. Of the 6998 patients, 6844 patients had complete baseline post-dose QTc interval data.

group.title: Fingolimod
group.description: Fingolimod 0.5 mg by mouth once daily for 7 days.

Cardiac events were defined as the following Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) preferred terms: angina pectoris, chest discomfort, dizziness, dyspnoea, dyspnoea exertional, fatigue, palpitations, syncope, vertigo, vertigo positional and vision blurred.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected for each patient from first administration of study drug until end of study visit, usually for one week. Furthermore, serious suspected adverse drug reactions (SADRs) had to be documented until 6 weeks after the patient has stopped study participation.

group.title: Fingolimod
group.description: Fingolimod 0.5 mg by mouth once daily for 7 days.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: 292 centers were initiated but 278 centers randomized patients.
